name: 900.1 - Method Statement Development / Job Safety & Environmental Analysis

Detail of Activity - Prepare shared services trench construction methodology and Job Safety & Environmental Analysis suitable for site (eg access, working areas, proximity to slopes, traffic and other site hazards, construction stages proposed)
Acceptance Criteria - Method Statement and JSEA Completed and signed by relevant authority.
Comments - Method Statement and Job Safety & Environmental Analysis to be provided to Engineer for review prior to commencing excavation on site.
Detail of Activity - Check drawings are for construction and latest revision. Check Specification is for construction and latest revision
Acceptance Criteria - Drawings and Specification are the latest revision.
Record documents - IFC Drawings and Specification
Comments - Up to date drawings and specification to be reviewed before construction.
Detail of Activity - Ensure power supply is organised and connection is in place
Minimum Test Frequency - once per set of traffic lights
Acceptance Criteria - Complete NC1 form and ensure ducting for power is in place.
Detail of Activity - Ensure comms connection is organised and ducting is in place
Minimum Test Frequency - once per set of traffic lights
Acceptance Criteria - Liase with service provider and organise connection (UCG) Universal communications group.
Detail of Activity - GPS Setout of the shared services trench location as per the construction drawings.
Minimum Test Frequency - All shared trenches.
Record documents - Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Comments - Setout location prior to commencing works.
900.6 - Sediment Controls are in place for the particular section
Detail of Activity - Check ESCP and ensure any controls needed are in place before excavation.
Minimum Test Frequency - once per section
Acceptance Criteria - Erosion and Sediment controls are in place prior to starting works.
Record documents - Contractor's site diary and/or photos
Detail of Activity - Walk over with TTOC, WSP, TSL & Downer representatives to agree positions of intersection elements
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - TTOC, WSP, TSL acceptance.
Detail of Activity - Draft CIS to be produced, independently reviewed and approved.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - Review completed and development approved.
Detail of Activity - Software to be independently tested using traffic signal emulator software (SFT Testing)
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - Approval for release received.
Record documents - SFT Test Result Summary Sheet
Detail of Activity - SFT files provided to create PROM, bench testing to be completed by TSL
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - Pass result for bench test on "Appendix H - Controller Bench Testing Form".
Record documents - Appendix H NZTA P43
Detail of Activity - Ensure poles are plumbed vertical
Detail of Activity - Pole Number Verification
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure poles are numbered correctly and match the CIS sheets (pole numbers match program and diagram numbers).
Acceptance Criteria - TSL engineer confirmation that poles are founded securely and have adequatley sized footings for the site conditions.
Detail of Activity - Soil Bearing Strength
Minimum Test Frequency - One per pole cluster area (i.e. north-eastern corner, median etc.)
Detail of Activity - Concrete Foundation Dimensions
Minimum Test Frequency - Each footing not within concrete or asphalt.
Acceptance Criteria - Where a pole is not surrounded by concrete, the pole must have 500mm2 of concrete surrounding it with a depth of 150mm (20MPa as below).
Detail of Activity - Footing Concrete Strength
Minimum Test Frequency - Each footing requiring concrete
Inspection / Test method - Visual Inspection/Concrete Dockets
Acceptance Criteria - Confirmation footing concrete strength (where required - i.e. delivery dockets) is min 20MPa at 28days, or as specified in foudation design.

Acceptance Criteria - Cabling to be continuous lengths from controller to the pole, and from pole to pole
(i.e. no joints between poles).
Detail of Activity - Looper Feeder Cable Slack
Acceptance Criteria - Following cable slacks to be provided:
Detail of Activity - Provide cable termination chart in controller cabinet.
Minimum Test Frequency - Each controller cabinet
Acceptance Criteria - Cable termination chart provided.
Detail of Activity - Complete earth loop impedance testing per 3.15.2 of NZTA P43.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection as specified in 3.15.2 of NZTA P43
Acceptance Criteria - Submit results in a report.
Detail of Activity - 500V test from the isolated conductors down to earth.
• Q ≥ 15 when measured in the kerbside junction box (KJB).
• Submit results signed by technician who conducted the testing and in a report.
Detail of Activity - 500V test from isolated conductors down to earth.
Minimum Test Frequency - All feeder cables
• Resistance of feeder cable ≤ 10 megaohms when measured at the controller. Submit results signed by technician who conducted the testing and in a report.
Detail of Activity - Log book detailing any attendance at site, reason for attending and brief description of work carried out.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per controller box
Acceptance Criteria - Log book provided/completed as required.
Detail of Activity - Completion and sign off of TTOC-07 Site Acceptance Test (SAT) documentation.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - All requirements satisfied and TTOC Traffic Signals Engineer signed acceptance of SAT document.
900.25 - Electrical certificate of compliance and record of inspection
Detail of Activity - Complete COC and ROI.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - Submit COC and ROI.
Detail of Activity - Submit completed and signed Appendix H forms 5 working days prior to commissioning.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - Submit Appendix H forms to TTOC.
Detail of Activity - Notify TTOC with 48hrs notice before commissioning lights.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per set of traffic lights/intersection
Acceptance Criteria - All above documentation is shown as attached to this work pack.
Detail of Activity - Controller Cabinet Information
Minimum Test Frequency - At time of commissioning
Acceptance Criteria - Laminated copies of below placed in document pocket inside controller cabinet, within two weeks of commissioning:
Minimum Test Frequency - At completion of construction
Inspection / Test method - Asbuilts to be submitted at the completion of construction, information to be captured regularly.

Acceptance Criteria - Asbuilts reviewed and submitted showing final location of all poles, access chambers, KJB, loops, lantern displays and cabinets. Completion and sign off of TTOC-08 Site Asset Collection Sheet/Appendix K of NZTA P43 documentation.
